item.title: Unicode strings in Python
item.author: adel.rahmani+dinkumdata@gmail.com (Adel Rahmani)
item.description: 1. Unicode: an introduction. Computers only understand one thing: binary code. For instance, when you type the letter “A” the computer must represent this as a sequence of 0s and 1s. Therefore we need a rule (code) for converting between characters and sequences of 0s and 1s. A basic way to do this is provided by the ASCII code. The ASCII code uses 1 byte (8 bits) to encode 256 possible characters, corresponding to a binary number between 0 and $255 = 2^7+2^6+2^5+2^4+2^3+2^2+2^1+2^0$.
